disqualify.translation[0].definitions[0]: to stop someone from taking part in an activity because they have broken a rule
They disqualified the team for fielding an underage player.
Disqualify is often passive in this meaning
disqualify.translation[0].definitions[1]: to unfairly prevent someone from doing a job or taking part in an activity
a system which disqualifies the poor from education
disqualify.translation[1].definitions[0]: to officially or legally stop someone being allowed to do something, because they have done something wrong
The General Medical Council had disqualified a doctor for misconduct.
He was disqualified from driving for a drink-driving offence.
